citeinfo.origin: United States. National Aeronautics and Space Administration
citeinfo.title: World Elevation, 2008

serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract: World Elevation, 2008 is a raster theme representing elevations worldwide. This dataset is comprised of data from the Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) between latitudes 60 degrees North and 56 degrees South at a resolution of 3 arc seconds (90 meters). The remaining polar regions are comprised of data from the Global Digital Elevation Model (GTOPO30) at a resolution of 30 arc seconds (+- 1 Km). In total this dataset is comprised of 12 tiles that have been merged into a raster catalog.
descript.purpose: World Elevation provides a base map layer displaying global elevation information for geographic analysis on global, regional, national, and Sub-national scales.
descript.supplinf: This dataset is available via the ArcSDE from the EDS lab via this .lyr file: https://www1.columbia.edu/sec/acis/eds/dgate/studies/C1301/data/WorldElevationLyr.zip

Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey, EROS Data Center Distributed Active Archive Center (EDC DAAC),
citeinfo.title: Global Digital Elevation Model (GTOPO30)

serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

procstep.procdesc: Data from GTOPO30 and SRTM DEMs were used to create worlwide coverage in 12 tiles. EDS staff imported the data into a raster catalog.
procstep.srcused: Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) Digital Elevation Model

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates
